summary: This is a brief email from an FBI agent in New York to another, referencing the need to sign 'chains' (likely chain of custody documents) for evidence that must be taken to a courthouse in relation to the Epstein case.

persons.name: Il=
persons.context: Primary recipient of the email, an FBI agent in New York, being asked if they are on their way to sign evidence chains.

connections.description: FBI agents in New York communicating about case-related logistics.
FBI agents in New York; M is copied on the email.
FBI agents in New York both involved in the email correspondence.

events.title: Evidence Chain Signing for Court
events.description: FBI agents need to sign chain of custody documents for evidence that must be transported to a courthouse.

keyFacts: The email is dated April 13, 2021, indicating ongoing legal proceedings related to Epstein years after his death.
It references the signing of 'chains,' which are likely chain of custody documents for evidence.
The evidence must be transported to a courthouse, suggesting active court proceedings or filings.
The correspondence is between FBI agents in New York, showing federal law enforcement involvement.
